title: TV best bets: Wed., October 21
text:
TV best bets: Wed., October 21 October 21, 2015 Last updated: Wednesday, October 21, 2015, 1:20 AM The Record Buy this photo Chloe Sevigny stars in "American Horror Story: Hotel" at 10 p.m. on FX. 
8 p.m., NBC: The Mysteries of Laura — Those working for a certain media empire may not be happy about being in the spotlight themselves in the new episode "The Mystery of the Watery Grave," as its chief loses his wife in an accident that sends her off a highway. The subsequent investigation ultimately steers Laura (Debra Messing) and her colleagues back to a case thought to have been solved long ago. 
9 p.m., CW/CHANNEL 11: Supernatural — Jensen Ackles, alias the series' Dean Winchester, takes on additional duty as director on the new episode "The Bad Seed." The tale puts his character and Sam (Jared Padalecki) on the trail of a baby who could be the key to stopping the Darkness — which Crowley (Mark Sheppard) hopes to exploit for his own purposes. 
10 p.m., FX: American Horror Story: Hotel — A tense Alex (Chloe Sevigny) feels that she is reaching the end of her rope after Scarlett stirs up some painful memories of Holden in a new episode titled "Mommy." Donovan (Matt Bomer), meanwhile, is thrust into jeopardy by a dangerous rival of the Countess (Lady Gaga). Kathy Bates and Wes Bentley also star. 
10:30 p.m., COMEDY CENTRAL: Moonbeam City — With Mayor Eo Jaxxon (voice of guest star Powers Boothe) determined to dismantle the police department, the cops decide to create a dramatic need for their services by manufacturing a new designer drug called Glitzotrene and creating a widespread drug epidemic throughout Moonbeam City. Rob Lowe, Will Arnett and Elizabeth Banks head the voice cast in the new episode "Glitzotrene: One Town's Seduction"; Carlos Alazraqui and Trace Adkins also have guest roles.
